dynamic_line.no: Oh, a pleasure to meet you. Come, sit, let us talk.

dynamic_line: So, what is it you desire?

responses.text: Your robes seem highly decorated, what do you do?

dynamic_line: I am the Elder, leader of our glorious sect. I oversee and conduct all that which occurs here.

responses.text: How did you come to acquire such a position?
With your position, is there anything I can do for you?

dynamic_line: It is a long tale, and I have work to do.
I was a Communer once, and advanced to the position of Elder following the passing of our founder; my predicesor.

Several years ago, our founder and origional Elder was gifted an otherwolrdly artifact, the Archaesth. It contains vast knowledge of other planes, magics, rituals, ecetera. I myself have read it in full. With time, they told others of their gift, and formed our sect to worship those who gave us. In time, it grew, and they could no longer host secret meetings within town. As such, this sanctuary was formed.

We continued our rites and meditation, acquiring more knowledge from the Elder Ones. Such was a glorious time, I do say. We filled the Hall with artifacts, and grew more than ever. Alas, it came to an end.

Several members began to dislike the direction we went. They belived restraint was nessecary, that we were asking to much of the patrons. So, they rose a rebellion to overthrow the founder, and sieze control. However, they were few in number, and those who remained loyal ended the rebellion, though not without loss.

They employed our own magics against us, and the sanctuary was nearly destroyed. My predicesor passed in combat when their spell misfired. Afterwards, I advanced to Elder, and guided the reconstitution of our organization. We excavated a small tomb, and buried the dead of combat therein, where our founder now rests.
